meanings.definition: Having a greater tendency to snack.
meanings.sent1: She is snackier than her brother, always reaching for chips.
meanings.sent2: The kids at the party were getting snackier as the evening went on.
meanings.sent3: The snackier squirrel in the park stole a cookie from a picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with a snackier gleam when she saw the dessert table.
meanings.sent5: The snackier cat pounced on any treat left unattended.

meanings.definition: Comparatively more inclined to eat snacks.
meanings.sent1: He felt snackier after watching a movie with popcorn.
meanings.sent2: The snackier students always had a stash of snacks in their backpacks.
meanings.sent3: The snackier puppy wagged its tail eagerly at the sight of treats.
meanings.sent4: The snackier birds flocked to the feeder filled with seeds.
meanings.sent5: The snackier child begged for a cookie before dinner.

meanings.sent1: The snackier coworker always had a bag of chips at their desk.
meanings.sent2: She became snackier during stressful times, seeking comfort in food.
meanings.sent3: The snackier friend could never resist a slice of cake.
meanings.sent4: His snackier nature led him to explore various snack options.
meanings.sent5: The snackier movie night featured a variety of treats for everyone.
